name: Telur Balado (Spicy Chile Sauce with Eggs)
author: Rani Rasfiardha
summary: Originated from North Sumatra (Padang or Minang), this humble dish can be easily bought from many street vendors (warung nasi). When I studied abroad, I found a shortcut to make this lovely dish. Serve with hot, steamed rice or Indonesian fried rice (nasi goreng) with prawn crackers on the side.
ingredients: 6  red chile peppers, seeded and chopped
directions: Heat 1 cup oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat
Deep fry the eggs in the hot oil until they are golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes; set aside
Combine the chile peppers, garlic, shallots, tomatoes, and shrimp paste in a food processor; blend into a paste
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Pour the chile pepper mixture into the skillet
Stir the vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper into the mixture
Add the fried eggs to the mixture, turning to coat
Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until fragrant, about 5 minutes
